intro: Senecio plebeius, commonly known as the blueweed or bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Senecio plebeius is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
